# Hello Bootstrapped !
I'm Justin Higgins and I know nothing about sales and marketing.
Let me explain.
I've been a professional software engineer for over 10 years now and have wanted to build something of my own. I've tried a few side projects but have had a pretty big flaw in my thinking execution:
I never wanted to *sell or market* my work.
That's no good.
So I built **24hourhomepage (dot) com** in order to get better at sales and marketing.
The service is simple: There are 86,400 seconds in a day and each is sold as an advertisement. Once each second is sold, the project is over and the site lives on indefinitely as an internet artifact.

item.dc:creator: yinhowlew
item.description:
Congrats on launching. Really fun product! reminds me of the million dollar homepage back in the days but with a more fun and engaging twist.

As a business, my natural first question is: what are your plans to get visitors to your site? It seems like something people might check out 1 time, but has little incentive to return.

Or maybe you are planning other distribution strategy - e.g. having the square embed to other websites / apps?
